column1: '''Fredegar "Fatty" Bolger''' was a Hobbit of [[the Shire]]. He was one of the close friends of [[Frodo Baggins
column2: Frodo]] who knew that he had the [[The One Ring
column3: Ring]] and helped him with his mission to leave the Shire.

column1: Fatty was a descendant of [[Hildibrand Took]] ({{TA
column3: 2934}}), one of the many sons of the [[Gerontius Took
column5: Took}}</ref> He was the son of [[Odovacar Bolger]] and [[Rosamunda Took]]. Fatty was born in {{TA
column6: 2980}} and his family was from [[Budgeford]] in [[Bridgefields]] of the [[Eastfarthing]]. He also had a younger sister, [[Estella Brandybuck

column1: Fredegar was a good friend of [[Frodo Baggins]]. In {{TA
column2: 3001}} he was a guest at [[Bilbo's Farewell Party]].<ref name=took/>

column1: Fatty was one of the [[Conspirators]], the friends of Frodo who knew that he was in an important mission to leave the Shire, and they assisted him without his knowledge. Fatty, along with [[Folco Boffin]] and Frodo's close circle, celebrated Frodo's last birthday in {{TA
column2: 3018}} before his departure from [[Hobbiton]]. Fatty and [[Meriadoc Brandybuck
column3: Merry]] then left for the house that Frodo had bought in [[Crickhollow]], in order to prepare it to be ready and habitable for his arrival.

column1: Frodo eventually came to his house, along with [[Samwise Gamgee
column3: Pippin]]. It was there when the conspirators revealed themselves to Frodo, and expressed their will to follow him in his mission. Fatty however was a typical hobbit who had never left the Shire and was unwilling to do so, but would play his role; he stayed behind to keep up the pretense that Frodo was there, by wearing his clothes and keep the house occupied, and deal with any "inquisitive folk".

column1: After hearing that Frodo was pursued by the [[Nazgûl
column2: Black Riders]], Fatty was given the option to flee with the others into the [[Old Forest]], which however didn't seem more inviting to him (although Merry tried to persuade him that the Riders were far more terrifying than the stories about the Old Forest). Fredegar therefore opted to remain behind as a decoy for the Nazgûl and as a messenger for [[Gandalf]] in case he showed up.<ref>{{FR

column1: The Ringwraiths did eventually come in the night of [[30 September]] to Crickhollow for Frodo and [[the One Ring
column2: the Ring]]. But Fatty, though frightened nearly witless, escaped to raise the alarm of [[Buckland]], causing the [[Brandybucks]] to sound the [[Horn-call of Buckland]]. This caused the Nazgûl to flee, but they had learned that the Ring was gone.<ref>{{FR

column1: During [[Saruman]]'s rule of [[the Shire]], Fatty led a group of partisans fighting against the [[Ruffians]] in the [[Brockenbores]] around the hills of [[Scary]] before eventually being captured. He was imprisoned in the [[Lockholes]] and starved, (and could no longer be called "Fatty") but was rescued after the victory of the [[Battle of Bywater]].<ref name="Havens"/>
The name contains ''ferdi'' "peace" and ''gar'' "spear"<ref>[[An Introduction to Elvish]], "Giving of Names"</ref>

In ''[[The Return of the Shadow]]'', Fatty Bolger is said to have played a much larger role, but this was later abandoned. His role survives as a minor anomaly in the published ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]'' - before the Hobbits go into the [[Old Forest]], they have five ponies prepared - but only take four. Fatty was originally supposed to go with them.
